projects.name: ADRmeta
projects.summary: A web app that fetches portraits from various archives in Amsterdam and attempts to connect these portraits by using facial recognition. This project was built in one week to show the Public Library of Amsterdam what could be done with the massive amounts of data collected by the Adamlink project.
projects.mission: How can combining massive amounts of archive data be made useful?

projects.name: JS-API-CONNECT
projects.shortDescription: ES6 library for easy API manipulation
projects.summary: An easy-to-use microlibrary for connecting with REST API's in JavaScript using ES6 modules and classes
projects.mission: Make connecting with REST api's more easier and more manageable

projects.name: kager.io
projects.summary:
Building sites is something I did long before programming. But building my own site was probably the most difficult. I am a perfectionist and I did not feel confident enough with my design skills.

I've made a few concepts over the last few years, but none made it to production. Now, finally. After finishing the Web Development minor at the Amsterdam University of Applied sciences, Eureka!
projects.mission:
A personal website which shows my skills, what I'm working on and how to contact me.

A 'digital CV' for HR/recruiters who are interested in hiring me, developers who want to work with me or people who like to keep up with me for other reasons

projects.name: CSS to the rescue
projects.summary: The first CSS project in the web-development minor. Challenging students to think outside the box with the latest CSS features but also laying a foundation with best-practices and design principles.
projects.mission: Illustrate how one can use the latest css selectors, no classes alowed. Design multiple website elements to get an understanding of the latest CSS capabilities.

projects.name: Exclusive Design
projects.summary: The final and  qualifying project of the minor Web Development at The University of Applied Sciences Amsterdam. Won the 2018 Golden Dot Award for Responsible Design for its accessibility experiments.
projects.mission: How can we design a website in such a way that it is pleasurable for people who need accessbibility features, without changing the experience.

projects.name: Remind
projects.shortDescription: Reminder app powered by a messenger bot
projects.summary: A simple web app where friends and family can send me reminders through a messenger bot.
projects.mission: I am a very forgetfull person and this web app should help me remind things. Whenever I should be reminded of something, my friends and fanily can send a quick message and it will be stored on remind.kager.io
